item.title: About Me
item.description: Short Bio I am a fourth-year Ph.D. student in Operations Research at Georgia Tech, working with Prof. X. Andy Sun. Before joining the Ph.D. program, I received my B.S. degrees in Industrial Engineering and Mathematics from the same institute. Broadly speaking, my research focuses on the theory and application of optimization. I am currently working on distributed and decomposition algorithms for large-scale continuous and discrete optimization problems with convergence guarantees. I am also interested in efficient and practical solution methods for nonconvex nonsmooth problems arising from data science and engineering fields.

item.title: Experience
item.description: Professional Experience Research intern at Alibaba US-Damo Academy, Bellevue, WA, Summer 2020 Mentors: Dr. Wotao Yin, Dr. Jian Tan, and Mou Sun Convergent decomposition algorithms for mixed-integer programs with block angular structures Georgia Tech, Atlanta, GA, 2017-present Graduate Research Assistant, 2018-present Graduate Teaching Assistant, 2017-2018 ISyE 6644 Simulation ISyE 6669 Deterministic Optimization Research collaboration with ISO New England on SOCP-OPF, 2017-2018 GO Competition A significant amount of my Ph.

item.title: Research
item.description: Research Interest Topics of recent interests include: Distributed and decomposition algorithms for continuous/discrete optimization Theory and algorithms based on nonconvex augmented Lagrangian duality Convexification and smoothing in optimization Publication and Preprint A two-level ADMM algorithm for AC OPF with convergence guarantees [pdf] Kaizhao Sun and X. Andy Sun, submitted, 2020 A two-level distributed algorithm for nonconvex constrained optimization [pdf] Kaizhao Sun and X. Andy Sun, submitted, 2019 Talks A Convergent Distributed Algorithm for AC OPF
